model_summary: A Fehr-Schmidt-based utility model for responder behavior in the ultimatum game. The model computes the utility of accepting an offer as the monetary share minus a penalty for advantageous inequality, scaled by a single learnable parameter.

A Fehr-Schmidt model for responder acceptance that computes utility as the monetary offer to the responder reduced by a penalty proportional to the advantageous inequity (the difference between the responder's and opponent's shares), with a single learnable parameter beta governing the aversion to inequity.

A Fehr–Schmidt-inspired utility model for responder behavior in the Ultimatum Game, where the responder’s utility equals their monetary share reduced by a penalty for advantageous inequality. The model uses one learnable parameter (beta_param) to capture inequality aversion.
